docs.abstract: The Trump administration may find itself facing the very dilemma the nuclear deal was designed to avoid.
docs.snippet: The Trump administration may find itself facing the very dilemma the nuclear deal was designed to avoid.
docs.lead_paragraph: The costs of the United States’ targeted killing of Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani, the commander of the Quds Force of Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps, are mounting beyond the already significant risks of Iranian retaliation and subsequent military confrontation.

headline.main: The Choice That’s Coming: An Iran With the Bomb, or Bombing Iran

byline.original: By Philip Gordon and Ariane Tabatabai

docs.abstract: A move meant to impose pain on the European Union may jeopardize many American jobs and businesses, while putting popular wines out of reach.
docs.snippet: A move meant to impose pain on the European Union may jeopardize many American jobs and businesses, while putting popular wines out of reach.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most years, January is a time for the wine trade to pause and congratulate itself.

headline.main: Wine Business Fears a Possible Disaster in Potential Trump Tariffs

docs.abstract: A Laurel Canyon house once owned by Lionel Barrymore, a Palm Springs home that belonged to Loretta Young and a picturesque cottage in Carmel.
docs.snippet: A Laurel Canyon house once owned by Lionel Barrymore, a Palm Springs home that belonged to Loretta Young and a picturesque cottage in Carmel.
docs.lead_paragraph: Once the vacation retreat of the actor Lionel Barrymore, this single-story house sits on a hillside in Laurel Canyon, about three miles northwest of Hollywood and 10 miles northwest of Downtown Los Angeles. Pace, a popular Italian restaurant, is a few minutes’ drive up Laurel Canyon Boulevard. Trader Joe’s and Chateau Marmont are half a mile south, on Sunset Boulevard.

docs.abstract: Demands for sexual pay-to-play by a rutting producer holding all the career cards may be horrific. But it’s not exactly a departure.
docs.snippet: Demands for sexual pay-to-play by a rutting producer holding all the career cards may be horrific. But it’s not exactly a departure.
docs.lead_paragraph: Harvey Weinstein, the universally accepted villain of the #MeToo movement, is a sinner, not a rapist, his defense attorney Donna Rotunno told Gayle King in a televised interview last September. Asked about her strategy in his criminal trial on charges of sexual assault and rape, set to begin on Monday, Ms. Rotunno offered an advance peek. There are always “blurred lines” and “an area of gray” between men and women in sexual circumstances, she said. And memory can be faulty “years later.” But she’s confident the evidence will exonerate her client.

headline.main: Harvey Weinstein Is Monster of the Moment, but the Whole System Is Rigged

docs.abstract: Because he’s just a bully with delusions of grandeur.
docs.snippet: Because he’s just a bully with delusions of grandeur.
docs.lead_paragraph: International crises often lead, at least initially, to surging support for a country’s leadership. And that’s clearly happening now. Just weeks ago the nation’s leader faced public discontent so intense that his grip on power seemed at risk. Now the assassination of Qassim Suleimani has transformed the situation, generating a wave of patriotism that has greatly bolstered the people in charge.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: They don’t have to lose their souls to do it. Just the opposite.
docs.snippet: They don’t have to lose their souls to do it. Just the opposite.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the aftermath of Donald Trump’s 2016 election victory, analysts fiercely debated the role of the approximately six million voters who supported President Barack Obama in 2012 but shifted their support to Mr. Trump in 2016. Democratic strategists also had to worry about their future behavior: Was 2016 a temporary blip or were these voters gone forever? With newly available data from the Cooperative Congressional Election Study survey, the largest publicly-available election survey, we can now analyze what happened with these Obama-Trump voters in 2018 and what that might portend for Mr. Trump’s re-election campaign.

headline.main: How Democrats Can Win Back Obama-Trump Defectors

byline.original: By Sean McElwee and Brian F. Schaffner

docs.abstract: As you fight a new battle, we owe you a debt of gratitude for being a moral compass for our nation.
docs.snippet: As you fight a new battle, we owe you a debt of gratitude for being a moral compass for our nation.
docs.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — Dear Mr. Lewis, I write with a heavy heart. Stage 4 pancreatic cancer is a brutal diagnosis, so it’s no surprise that last Sunday night the internet erupted with anguish as news of your illness became public. Treatment may give you a “fighting chance” to continue working “for the Beloved Community,” as you wrote in a statement, but it’s painful to think of what you will be called on to bear in the coming months. You have already borne so much for us.

headline.main: An Open Letter to John Lewis

docs.abstract: Aerobanquets RMX lets participants eat while exploring an interactive world at the James Beard House.
docs.snippet: Aerobanquets RMX lets participants eat while exploring an interactive world at the James Beard House.
docs.lead_paragraph: One rainy afternoon, I floated over a galaxy of egg yolks and spiky gumball tree seeds, and plucked a fork-shaped constellation from the asteroids.

headline.main: Flavorful Bites in a Virtual Reality
headline.print_headline: Taste the Future: A Virtual Reality Banquet

docs.abstract: Beijing is racing to identify a new illness that has sickened 59 people as it tries to calm a nervous public.
docs.snippet: Beijing is racing to identify a new illness that has sickened 59 people as it tries to calm a nervous public.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — For days, Li Bin had what felt like a cold, with a high fever of between 102 and 105, and he could not understand why he wasn’t getting better.

headline.main: China Grapples With Mystery Pneumonia-Like Illness
headline.print_headline: China, Eager to Calm a Nervous Public, Grapples With Mystery Illness

byline.original: By Sui-Lee Wee and Vivian Wang

docs.abstract: Our notes and favorite images from the fall 2020 runways.
docs.snippet: Our notes and favorite images from the fall 2020 runways.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fall 2020 men’s shows have now come to a close, but T’s photographers were on the ground to catch all of the action in London, Florence, Milan and Paris. Here, our day-by-day recaps, along with our favorite images from the runways.

headline.main: All the Best Pictures From the Men’s Fashion Shows
